div1.p: IN THE SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES.
IN THE MATTER OF THEUNLAWFUL DETENTION OF SEVENTY-THREE HINDOO ALIENS.
No. 2532 CITATION TO THE SUPREME COURT.
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
TO THE COMMISSIONER OF IMMIGRATION, SEATTLE, AND THE UNITED STATES ATTORNEY:

You are hereby notified that in a certain cause in equity in the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, wherein seventy-three Hindoo aliens are petitioners, the petitioners therein have prayed an appeal to the Supreme Court of the United States from the decree in said cause entered, and that such appeal has been allowed; where- fore you are hereby cited and admonished to be and appear at the Supreme Court of the United States at Washington, within sixty (60) days from the date hereof, to show cause, if any there be, why the decree appealed from should not be reversed and set aside, and relief be granted to said appellants as by them prayed and as to justice and equity may appertain.
WITNESS, the Honorable Edward Douglass White, Chief Justice of te Suprreme Court of the United States, this 30th day of September, 1913.
Jeremiah Neterer JUDGE.
ATTEST my hand and the seal of the United States District Court of the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, at the Clerk's office at Seattle, Washington, the day and year above written.
FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk
By Edm Laken By Clerk, United States District Court, Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
Due, legal and timely service of the foregoing citation admitted this 1st day of October, 1913.
E B Brockway Asst. U.S. Attorney
IN THE SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES.
IN THE MATTER OF THE UNLAWFUL DETENTION OF SEVENTY-THREE HINDOO ALIENS.
CITATION TO THE SUPREME COURT.
FILED IN THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT, Western Dist. of Washington Oct 4 1913 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk
By BOM Deputy
HERBERT W. MEYERS ATTORNEY AT LAW 430-431-432-433 PIONEER BUILDING PHONE MAIN 1278 SEATTLE, WASH. MERCHANTS PRINTING., TIMES BLDG., SEATTLE
